a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: The maternal mortality ratio in 2000 and 2017
Maternal mortality ratio is the number of women who die from pregnancy-related causes while pregnant
or within 42 days of pregnancy termination per 100,000 live births. Shown here is the modeled estimate
as explained in the Sources. Countries above the grey line had a higher maternal mortality ratio in 2000
Data source: World Health Organization (via World Bank)
